   subroutine getFail(b, m, f)

      integer, intent(in) :: m

      character(len=1), dimension(1:m), intent(in) :: b

      integer, dimension(0:N), intent(out) :: f

            j = j +1

         f(i) = j

program main

   implicit none

   integer, parameter :: maxn = 200, maxb = 400, N = 400

   character(len=maxn) :: s1, str

   character(len=1) :: b(maxb)

   integer :: n, f(0:N), A, B, C, i, j, m, sqrt_x, x, is_prime

   ! Read input

   read(*,*) n

   read(*, '(a)') s1

   read(*, '(a)') str

   ! Fill b array

   do i = 1, n

      b(i) = str(i:i)

   end do

   do i = 1, n

      b(n + i) = s1(i:i)

   end do

   m = 2*n

   ! Compute failure function

   call getFail(b(1:m), m, f)

   ! Compute A = 2*n - min(f(m), n)

   A = 2*n - min(f(m), n)

   ! Compute B

   if (A == 1) then

      B = 0

   else

      B = 1

   end if

   ! Compute C via third program's logic

   x = B

   if (x == 2) then

      ! do nothing, x is already prime

   else if (mod(x,2) ==0) then

      x = x +1

   end if

   do while (.true.)

      sqrt_x = int(sqrt(real(x)))

      is_prime = 1  ! Assume prime until proven otherwise

      do i = 3, sqrt_x, 2

         if (mod(x, i) ==0) then

            is_prime = 0

            exit

         end if

      end do

      if (is_prime ==1) exit

      x = x +2

   end do

   C = x

   ! Output C

   print *, C

contains

   subroutine getFail(b, m, f)

      integer, intent(in) :: m

      character(len=1), dimension(1:m), intent(in) :: b

      integer, dimension(0:N), intent(out) :: f

      integer :: i, j

      f(0) = 0

      f(1) = 0

      j = 0

      do i = 2, m

         do while (j >0 .and. b(j+1) /= b(i))

            j = f(j)

         end do

         if (b(j+1) == b(i)) then

            j = j +1

         end if

         f(i) = j

      end do

   end subroutine getFail

end program main
